attributes.action: NHS CONSTITUTION - MAINTAIN OUR CITIZEN'S RIGHTS TO FREE HEALTH CARE AT THE POINT OF DELIVERY
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Our Government are considering proposals for an NHS Consititution,   

In the media there were suggestions that certain aspects of health care may be denied to people who smoke & drink etc., ie:- 

"Government officials have admitted the new constitution would mean patients would need to look at their lifestyles and take more responsibility, and make sure they turn up for appointments."

"If you are smoking too much, should you be entitled to an operation?" a Department of Health representative told a national paper.

No 10 have since said,  "No such proposals exist"  

Our taxes, from whatever source
including those levied on alcohol & tobacco etc., contribute to our NHS 

Therefore, I urge  Citizens' to sign this petition so that Government are aware of the people's feelings, in respect of maintaining our rights to free health care at the point of delivery.

rejection.details: Such a request will make sense only if such proposals come into existence. Currently they do not exist.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
